intro: Hydriastele cylindrocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hydriastele, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. Hydriastele cylindrocarpa is adapted to arid conditions and is known for its resilience in harsh environments.
